intro: Centaurea sanandajensis, commonly known as Sanandaj thistle, is a flowering plant native to Iran. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky and arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its bright yellow flowers are surrounded by spiny bracts, giving it a distinctive appearance. Centaurea sanandajensis is of interest to botanists due to its limited distribution and potential ecological significance in its native habitat.
